haul.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement
haul.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
I hauled the door shut behind me.
She hauled her backpack onto her back.
haul something off/onto/out of etc something
haul.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a large amount of illegal or stolen goods
haul.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The gang escaped with a haul worth hundreds of pounds.
A haul of stolen cars has been seized by police officers.
haul.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net
haul.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if a train or TRUCK hauls goods, it takes them from one place to another
haul.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The freight train hauled the load of 240 tons with ease.
Union Pacific hauls garbage from Seattle to a landfill in eastern Oregon.
haul.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to officially make someone go to a senior manager, committee, or court to be judged on something they have done, especially something bad
haul.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Officials can be hauled before Congressional committees and asked to justify their policies.
haul somebody before/in front of somebody/something
Bar staff who serve drunk drivers may get hauled up in front of the local judge if those people are later involved in accidents.
haul somebody before/in front of somebody/something
haul.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to speak to someone angrily and severely because they have done something wrong
haul.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: He might be hauled over the coals and forced to resign if his manager did not agree with his actions.
haul.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the amount of fish caught in one net or in one period of time
haul.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Demand for fishing boats depends on estimated sizes of fish hauls.
haul.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a large amount of stolen or illegal goods that has been found by the police or CUSTOMS
haul.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: A haul of stolen cars has been seized by police.
haul.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: connected with long or short journeys by plane
haul.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: KLM earns most of its revenue on long-haul flights.
